member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Shared.TlsVersions
member.summary: A common place to specify TLS information for the project, when the code must be explicit or a user requires an override.
member.remarks: As newer TLS versions come out, we should simply update them here and have all code that needs to know reference this class so they all get updated and we don't risk missing a line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Shared.TlsVersions.Instance
member.summary: A static instance of this class to be used by the Azure IoT .NET SDKs when opening connections

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Shared.TlsVersions.#ctor
member.summary: Internal constructor for testing. The SDK and users should use the static Instance property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Shared.TlsVersions.MinimumTlsVersions
member.summary: The acceptable versions of TLS to use when the SDK must be explicit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Shared.TlsVersions.Preferred
member.summary: The version of TLS to use by default.
member.remarks: Defaults to "None", which means let the OS decide the proper TLS version (SChannel in Windows / OpenSSL in Linux).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Shared.TlsVersions.CertificateRevocationCheck
member.summary: To enable certificate revocation check. Default to be false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Shared.TlsVersions.SetMinimumTlsVersions(System.Security.Authentication.SslProtocols)
member.summary: Sets the minimum acceptable versions of TLS.
member.remarks:
Will ignore a version less than TLS 1.0.
Affects: 1. MinimumTlsVersions property 2. Preferred property 3. For .NET framework 4.5.1 over HTTPS or websocket, as it does not offer a "SystemDefault" option, the version must be explicit.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Shared.TlsVersions.SetLegacyAcceptableVersions
member.summary: Sets the acceptable versions of TLS over HTTPS or websocket for .NET framework 4.5.1, as it does not offer a "SystemDefault" option. No-op for other .NET versions. Sets CheckCertificateRevocationList property to value of CertificateRevocationCheck for .NET framework 4.5.1

member.summary: The transport will fall-back to corresponding websocket if tcp connection fails.

member.summary: WebSocket only connection with no fall-back.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Shared.TransportFallbackType.TcpOnly
member.summary: Tcp only connection with no fall-back.

member.summary: Creates instance of . Shouldn't use this constructor since _metadata is null and calling GetLastUpdated can result in NullReferenceException

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Shared.TwinCollection.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a using a JSON fragment as the body.
member.remarks: Use "JsonConvert.DeserializeObject()" instead of "JObject.Parse()" so that we can take advantage of the internal serializer settings added in SDK and avoid of the unexpected behavior of dropping trailing zeros caused by Newtonsoft.Json.
member.param: JSON fragment containing the twin data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Shared.TwinCollection.#ctor(System.String,System.String)

member.param: JSON fragment containing the twin data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Shared.TwinCollection.Contains(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified property is present.
member.returns: true if the specified property is present; otherwise, false

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Shared.TwinCollection.TryGetMemberInternal(System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: Gets the specified property from the twin collection.
member.param: The name of the property to get.
The value to return from the property collection.
member.returns: A as an if the metadata is not present; otherwise it will return a , a or a .
member.remarks:
If this method is used with a returned from a DeviceClient it will always return a . However, if you are using this method with a returned from a RegistryManager client, it will return the corresponding type depending on what is stored in the properties collection.
For example a would return a , with the metadata intact, when used with a returned from a RegistryManager client. If you need this method to always return a please see the method for more information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Shared.TwinCollection.ClearMetadata
member.summary: Clears metadata out of the twin collection.
member.remarks: This will only clear the metadata from the twin collection but will not change the base metadata object. This allows you to still use methods such as . If you need to remove all metadata, please use .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Devices.Shared.TwinCollection.ClearAllMetadata
member.summary: Clears all metadata out of the twin collection as well as the base metadata object.
member.remarks: This will remove all metadata from the base metadata object as well as the metadata for the twin collection. The difference from the method is this will also clear the underlying metadata object which will affect methods such as and . This method would be useful if you are performing any operations that require to return a regardless of the client you are using.
